values.authorQuote: It has always been the prerogative of children and half-wits to point out that the emperor has no clothes. But the half-wit remains a half-wit, and the emperor remains an emperor.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: The imagination is a muscle. If it is not exercised, it atrophies.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: This is a work of fiction. All the characters in it, human and otherwise, are imaginary, excepting only certain of the fairy folk, whom it might be unwise to offend by casting doubts on their existence. Or lack thereof.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: Sometimes the best way to learn something is by doing it wrong and looking at what you did.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: Is the chemical aftertaste the reason why people eat hot dogs, or is it some kind of bonus?
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: The first author I remember being obsessed by, actually realizing 'I like the way he writes and I like the way he tells stories,' was C.S. Lewis and the 'Narnia' books.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: I've never known anyone who was what he or she seemed; or at least, was only what he or she seemed. People carry worlds within them.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: So I went out and bought myself a copy of the Writer and Artist Yearbook, bought lots of magazines and got on the phone and talked to editors about ideas for stories. Pretty soon I found myself hired to do interviews and articles and went off and did them.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: And there never was an apple, in Adam's opinion, that wasn't worth the trouble you got into for eating it.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: When I was a kid, we actually lived in a house that had been divided in two at one point, which meant that one room in our house opened up onto a brick wall. And I was convinced all I had to do was just open it the right way and it wouldn't be a brick wall. So I'd sidle over to the door and I'd pull it open.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: Make good art.
values.author: Neil Gaiman
values.authorOccupation: Author, comic book creator, screenwriter, voice actor

values.authorQuote: It always seems impossible until it's done.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: To deny people their human rights is to challenge their very humanity.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Our human compassion binds us the one to the other - not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: I will not leave South Africa, nor will I surrender. Only through hardship, sacrifice and militant action can freedom be won. The struggle is my life. I will continue fighting for freedom until the end of my days.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: If you want to make peace with your enemy, you have to work with your enemy. Then he becomes your partner.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Forget the past.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Courageous people do not fear forgiving, for the sake of peace.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Let freedom reign. The sun never set on so glorious a human achievement.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: If there are dreams about a beautiful South Africa, there are also roads that lead to their goal. Two of these roads could be named Goodness and Forgiveness.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Where globalization means, as it so often does, that the rich and powerful now have new means to further enrich and empower themselves at the cost of the poorer and weaker, we have a responsibility to protest in the name of universal freedom.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: Without education, your children can never really meet the challenges they will face. So it's very important to give children education and explain that they should play a role for their country.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: No country can really develop unless its citizens are educated.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: A good leader can engage in a debate frankly and thoroughly, knowing that at the end he and the other side must be closer, and thus emerge stronger. You don't have that idea when you are arrogant, superficial, and uninformed.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: In my country we go to prison first and then become President.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: We must use time wisely and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right.
values.author: Nelson Mandela
values.authorBirthplace: Mvezo, Cape Province, Union of South Africa

values.authorQuote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Politics have no relation to morals.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: There is nothing more difficult to take in hand, more perilous to conduct, or more uncertain in its success, than to take the lead in the introduction of a new order of things.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: I'm not interested in preserving the status quo; I want to overthrow it.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: There are three kinds of intelligence: one kind understands things for itself, the other appreciates what others can understand, the third understands neither for itself nor through others. This first kind is excellent, the second good, and the third kind useless.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Men are so simple and so much inclined to obey immediate needs that a deceiver will never lack victims for his deceptions.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: One who deceives will always find those who allow themselves to be deceived.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Men rise from one ambition to another: first, they seek to secure themselves against attack, and then they attack others.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Of mankind we may say in general they are fickle, hypocritical, and greedy of gain.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: The one who adapts his policy to the times prospers, and likewise that the one whose policy clashes with the demands of the times does not.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Before all else, be armed.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: War should be the only study of a prince. He should consider peace only as a breathing-time, which gives him leisure to contrive, and furnishes as ability to execute, military plans.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: A return to first principles in a republic is sometimes caused by the simple virtues of one man. His good example has such an influence that the good men strive to imitate him, and the wicked are ashamed to lead a life so contrary to his example.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: The wish to acquire more is admittedly a very natural and common thing; and when men succeed in this they are always praised rather than condemned. But when they lack the ability to do so and yet want to acquire more at all costs, they deserve condemnation for their mistakes.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: It is necessary for him who lays out a state and arranges laws for it to presuppose that all men are evil and that they are always going to act according to the wickedness of their spirits whenever they have free scope.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: A son can bear with equanimity the loss of his father, but the loss of his inheritance may drive him to despair.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: It is much more secure to be feared than to be loved.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: A wise ruler ought never to keep faith when by doing so it would be against his interests.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Severities should be dealt out all at once, so that their suddenness may give less offense; benefits ought to be handed ought drop by drop, so that they may be relished the more.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Tardiness often robs us opportunity, and the dispatch of our forces.
values.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
values.authorOccupation: diplomat, politician, historian, philosopher, humanist, writer of the Renaissance period

values.authorQuote: Your victory is right around the corner. Never give up.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: You wanna know what scares people? Success. When you don't make moves and when you don't climb up the ladder, everybody loves you because you're not competition.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: Maybe your weird is my normal. Who's to say?
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: My advice to women in general: Even if you're doing a nine-to-five job, treat yourself like a boss. Not arrogant, but be sure of what you want - and don't allow people to run anything for you without your knowledge.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: But, by just being myself, I end up touching a lot more people who might never have paid much attention to a female rapper.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: You have to know that as long as you love who you are - your morals, your values, that type of stuff - you're OK.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I want to show little girls that the possibilities are endless. That's my goal - to not only do it for myself, but to show them I can do whatever I put my mind to.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: If I'm traveling, I'll pack socks in my bag - really cute furry ones.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I've always been the type of person to make everybody happy and get things done. I want everything to be 100% perfect.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I've always been intrigued by color and by interesting hair. I was one of those weird little girls doing my own hair at the age of 9. I was, like, getting weird gels and new brushes and cornrow holders. I would tweak and perm at the age of 13.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: When people see my makeup, they think all types of crazy things that I'm doing to my skin, but it's makeup. It's the weirdest thing. They'll see contouring and think you had surgery on your nose. No. No. No. Look at 'RuPaul's Drag Race' and you'll see... you can make your nose look... what ever shape you want it.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I don't want children cursing. I'm very strict on my nieces and my little brother. They have to listen to clean versions of music. Even my music.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I've constantly tried new things, even as a child, and have always been obsessed with pink. Now I'm just a little more ladylike and fearless. You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I hate formal stuff. I love looking like a doll and all that stuff and playing dress up, but when I'm home, sweat pants, t-shirt. When I'm in the studio, sweat pants, t-shirt.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I don't agree that everyone should agree with everyone's lifestyle. I think that some people aren't going to agree, but I think that when you're mean and when you ridicule people it's a sign of your own insecurities.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I don't mind being called a weirdo.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I think a child may be the only thing that could give me true happiness.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I can't see myself without pink lipstick. I can go without it for a couple days, but if there was no more pink lipstick in the world, I'd be useless. Seriously.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I say nice things about Mariah all the time. I tell Mariah all the time how much of a fan I am of her. She's one of my favorite artists of all time... She's shaped a generation of singers.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: As a little girl growing up in Southside Jamaica Queens, if anyone would've told me I'd have my own perfume one day, and be able to inspire young black girls everywhere, to go into Macy's or Nordstrom's and see their face staring back at them - I wouldn't believe them.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I do have a few personalities. When people started making a big deal out of it, I started making names for these people.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: I want people - especially young girls - to know that in life, nothing is going to be based on sex appeal. You've got to have something else to go with that.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: My goal the whole time has been for people to see me as a stand-alone artist. I came out with Young Money, the biggest hip-hop label in the world at the time. And then it was, 'How do I branch away from Lil Wayne?'
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: My wigs are ever changing in height, width, color, size. They make me feel happy. Wearing them makes me feel like I can be a different person every day and that is kind of exciting.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: Sometimes I wake up in the morning and I am like, 'This is a high-top day' or 'This is a bob day,' but when I get my clothes on that's when I see.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: Like to me, I did the 'Harajuku' stuff. I did the crazy stuff. And now I kind of want to tone that back, and it's not toning my personality back, it's just showing like I don't only have to do that.
values.author: Nicki Minaj

values.authorQuote: It is paradoxical, yet true, to say, that the more we know, the more ignorant we become in the absolute sense, for it is only through enlightenment that we become conscious of our limitations. Precisely one of the most gratifying results of intellectual evolution is the continuous opening up of new and greater prospects.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: I do not think you can name many great inventions that have been made by married men.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success... such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The scientists of today think deeply instead of clearly. One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: With ideas it is like with dizzy heights you climb: At first they cause you discomfort and you are anxious to get down, distrustful of your own powers; but soon the remoteness of the turmoil of life and the inspiring influence of the altitude calm your blood; your step gets firm and sure and you begin to look - for dizzier heights.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: We have soon to have everywhere smoke annihilators, dust absorbers, ozonizers, sterilizers of water, air, food and clothing, and accident preventers on streets, elevated roads and in subways. It will become next to impossible to contract disease germs or get hurt in the city, and country folk will got to town to rest and get well.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Modern science says: 'The sun is the past, the earth is the present, the moon is the future.' From an incandescent mass we have originated, and into a frozen mass we shall turn. Merciless is the law of nature, and rapidly and irresistibly we are drawn to our doom.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Today's scientists have substituted mathematics for experiments, and they wander off through equation after equation, and eventually build a structure which has no relation to reality.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The year 2100 will see eugenics universally established. In past ages, the law governing the survival of the fittest roughly weeded out the less desirable strains. Then man's new sense of pity began to interfere with the ruthless workings of nature. As a result, we continue to keep alive and to breed the unfit.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: When a coil is operated with currents of very high frequency, beautiful brush effects may be produced, even if the coil be of comparatively small dimensions. The experimenter may vary them in many ways, and, if it were nothing else, they afford a pleasing sight.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The feeling is constantly growing on me that I had been the first to hear the greeting of one planet to another.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The spread of civilisation may be likened to a fire; first, a feeble spark, next a flickering flame, then a mighty blaze, ever increasing in speed and power.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Every living being is an engine geared to the wheelwork of the universe. Though seemingly affected only by its immediate surrounding, the sphere of external influence extends to infinite distance.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Of the various branches of electrical investigation, perhaps the most interesting and immediately the most promising is that dealing with alternating currents.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: In the twenty-first century, the robot will take the place which slave labor occupied in ancient civilization.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The history of science shows that theories are perishable. With every new truth that is revealed we get a better understanding of Nature and our conceptions and views are modified.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: Archimedes was my ideal. I admired the works of artists, but to my mind, they were only shadows and semblances. The inventor, I thought, gives to the world creations which are palpable, which live and work.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The human being is a self-propelled automaton entirely under the control of external influences. Willful and predetermined though they appear, his actions are governed not from within, but from without. He is like a float tossed about by the waves of a turbulent sea.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: There is no doubt that some plant food, such as oatmeal, is more economical than meat, and superior to it in regard to both mechanical and mental performance. Such food, moreover, taxes our digestive organs decidedly less, and, in making us more contented and sociable, produces an amount of good difficult to estimate.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter - for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: There is no conflict between the ideal of religion and the ideal of science, but science is opposed to theological dogmas because science is founded on fact. To me, the universe is simply a great machine which never came into being and never will end. The human being is no exception to the natural order. Man, like the universe, is a machine.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: If we want to reduce poverty and misery, if we want to give to every deserving individual what is needed for a safe existence of an intelligent being, we want to provide more machinery, more power. Power is our mainstay, the primary source of our many-sided energies.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: In a time not distant, it will be possible to flash any image formed in thought on a screen and render it visible at any place desired. The perfection of this means of reading thought will create a revolution for the better in all our social relations.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: From my childhood I had been intended for the clergy. This prospect hung like a dark cloud on my mind.
values.author: Nikola Tesla
values.authorOccupation: Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, futurist

values.authorQuote: There are very few people who are going to look into the mirror and say, 'That person I see is a savage monster;' instead, they make up some construction that justifies what they do.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Colorless green ideas sleep furiously.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Debt is a trap, especially student debt, which is enormous, far larger than credit card debt. It's a trap for the rest of your life because the laws are designed so that you can't get out of it. If a business, say, gets in too much debt, it can declare bankruptcy, but individuals can almost never be relieved of student debt through bankruptcy.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Wanton killing of innocent civilians is terrorism, not a war against terrorism.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: You never need an argument against the use of violence, you need an argument for it.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Language is a process of free creation; its laws and principles are fixed, but the manner in which the principles of generation are used is free and infinitely varied. Even the interpretation and use of words involves a process of free creation.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: The more you can increase fear of drugs and crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all the people.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: All over the place, from the popular culture to the propaganda system, there is constant pressure to make people feel that they are helpless, that the only role they can have is to ratify decisions and to consume.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Is the Iranian record of intervention and terror worse than that of the U.S.?
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: If you're teaching today what you were teaching five years ago, either the field is dead or you are.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: The major advances in speed of communication and ability to interact took place more than a century ago. The shift from sailing ships to telegraph was far more radical than that from telephone to email!
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Some may remember, if you have good memories, that there used to be a concept in Anglo-American law called a presumption of innocence, innocent until proven guilty in a court of law. Now that's so deep in history that there's no point even bringing it up, but it did once exist.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Nationalism has a way of oppressing others.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: With the development of industrial capitalism, a new and unanticipated system of injustice, it is libertarian socialism that has preserved and extended the radical humanist message of the Enlightenment and the classical liberal ideals that were perverted into an ideology to sustain the emerging social order.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Rational discussion is useful only when there is a significant base of shared assumptions.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: I stated that Hiroshima and Nagasaki are 'among the most unspeakable crimes in history.' I took no position on just where they stand on the scale of horrors relative to Auschwitz, the bombing of Chungking, Lidice, and so on.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Either you repeat the same conventional doctrines everybody is saying, or else you say something true, and it will sound like it's from Neptune.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: The process of shaping opinion, attitudes, and perceptions was termed the 'engineering of consent' by one of the founders of the modern public relations industry, Edward Bernays.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: As a Zionist youth leader in the 1940s, I was among those who called for a binational state in Mandatory Palestine. When a Jewish state was declared, I felt that it should have the rights of other states - no more, no less.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Our only real hope for democracy is that we get the money out of politics entirely and establish a system of publicly funded elections.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: It is a virtual reflex for governments to plead security concerns when they undertake any controversial action, often as a pretext for something else.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: NATO was constructed on the - with the reason, whether one believes it or not, that it was going to defend Western Europe from Russian assault. Once the Berlin Wall fell and the Soviet Union was beginning to collapse, that reason was gone. So, first question: why does NATO exist?
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: I like Gramsci. He's an important person.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: The elections are run by the same industries that sell toothpaste on television.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: The Japanese bombing of Pearl Harbor led to many very good things. If you follow the trail, it led to kicking Europeans out of Asia - that saved tens of millions of lives in India alone.
values.author: Noam Chomsky
values.authorOccupation: Linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, historian, social critic

values.authorQuote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: There is a real magic in enthusiasm. It spells the difference between mediocrity and accomplishment.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: It's always too early to quit.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Action is a great restorer and builder of confidence. Inaction is not only the result, but the cause, of fear. Perhaps the action you take will be successful; perhaps different action or adjustments will have to follow. But any action is better than no action at all.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles, but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Getting people to like you is merely the other side of liking them.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: We struggle with the complexities and avoid the simplicities.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself as succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture... Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Understanding can overcome any situation, however mysterious or insurmountable it may appear to be.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Every problem has in it the seeds of its own solution. If you don't have any problems, you don't get any seeds.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: We tend to get what we expect.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: We've all heard that we have to learn from our mistakes, but I think it's more important to learn from successes. If you learn only from your mistakes, you are inclined to learn only errors.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Drop the idea that you are Atlas carrying the world on your shoulders. The world would go on even without you. Don't take yourself so seriously.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Be interesting, be enthusiastic... and don't talk too much.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: When you pray for anyone you tend to modify your personal attitude toward him.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Four things for success: work and pray, think and believe.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Promises are like crying babies in a theater, they should be carried out at once.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: You will soon break the bow if you keep it always stretched.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: When every physical and mental resources is focused, one's power to solve a problem multiplies tremendously.
values.author: Norman Vincent Peale

values.authorQuote: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: There is an immeasurable distance between late and too late.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: I will form good habits and become their slave. And how will I accomplish this difficult feat? Through these scrolls it will be done, for each scroll contains a principle which will drive a bad habit from my life and replace it with one which will bring me closer to success.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: I have never heard anything about the resolutions of the apostles, but a good deal about their acts.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Sound character provides the power with which a person may ride the emergencies of life instead of being overwhelmed by them. Failure is... the highway to success.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: It is those who concentrates on but one thing at a time who advance in this world. The great man or woman is the one who never steps outside his or her specialty or foolishly dissipates his or her individuality.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: To be always intending to make a new and better life but never to find time to set about it is as to put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day to the next until you're dead.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Do all things with love.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile!
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: I am here for a purpose and that purpose is to grow into a mountain, not to shrink to a grain of sand. Henceforth will I apply ALL my efforts to become the highest mountain of all and I will strain my potential until it cries for mercy.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: You never know what events are going to transpire to get you home.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: To do anything truly worth doing, I must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger, but jump in with gusto and scramble through as well as I can.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
values.author: Og Mandino

values.authorQuote: Where we love is home - home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness, of hatred, of jealousy, and, most easily of all, the gate of fear.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: To reach a port we must sail, sometimes with the wind, and sometimes against it. But we must not drift or lie at anchor.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: The Amen of nature is always a flower.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Truth is tough. It will not break, like a bubble, at a touch; nay, you may kick it about all day like a football, and it will be round and full at evening.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: A moment's insight is sometimes worth a life's experience.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Don't flatter yourselves that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. On the contrary, the nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Speak clearly, if you speak at all; carve every word before you let it fall.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Some people are so heavenly minded that they are no earthly good.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Why can't somebody give us a list of things that everybody thinks and nobody says, and another list of things that everybody says and nobody thinks?
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: People who honestly mean to be true really contradict themselves much more rarely than those who try to be 'consistent'.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Many people die with their music still in them. Why is this so? Too often it is because they are always getting ready to live. Before they know it, time runs out.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Fresh air is good if you do not take too much of it; most of the achievements and pleasures of life are in bad air.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: The mind of a bigot to the pupil of the eye; the more light you pour on it, the more it contracts.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Love prefers twilight to daylight.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Simple people... are very quick to see the live facts which are going on about them.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Don't you stay at home of evenings? Don't you love a cushioned seat in a corner, by the fireside, with your slippers on your feet?
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: The world's great men have not commonly been great scholars, nor its great scholars great men.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Controversy equalizes fools and wise men in the same way - and the fools know it.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: I think that, as life is action and passion, it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of his time at peril of being judged not to have lived.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: Most people are willing to take the Sermon on the Mount as a flag to sail under, but few will use it as a rudder by which to steer.
values.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

values.authorQuote: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: You can either see yourself as a wave in the ocean or you can see yourself as the ocean.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing that nobody's going to know whether you did it or not.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: I still have my feet on the ground, I just wear better shoes.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: When I look into the future, it's so bright it burns my eyes.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Being human means you will make mistakes. And you will make mistakes, because failure is God's way of moving you in another direction.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Whatever has happened to you in your past has no power over this present moment, because life is now.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: I don't think you ever stop giving. I really don't. I think it's an on-going process. And it's not just about being able to write a check. It's being able to touch somebody's life.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: If you come to fame not understanding who you are, it will define who you are.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Excellence is the best deterrent to racism or sexism.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: What material success does is provide you with the ability to concentrate on other things that really matter. And that is being able to make a difference, not only in your own life, but in other people's lives.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: If you want to accomplish the goals of your life, you have to begin with the spirit.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: The whole point of being alive is to evolve into the complete person you were intended to be.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: So go ahead. Fall down. The world looks different from the ground.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: Understand that the right to choose your own path is a sacred privilege. Use it. Dwell in possibility.
values.author: Oprah Winfrey
values.authorOccupation: Host of The Oprah Winfrey Show (1986–2011), Chairwoman and CEO of Harpo Productions (1986–present), Chairwoman, CEO, and CCO of the Oprah Winfrey Network (2011–present), Actress, Author

values.authorQuote: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Create your own visual style... let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Nobody gets justice. People only get good luck or bad luck.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: If you want a happy ending, that depends, of course, on where you stop your story.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I have an unfortunate personality.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: If there hadn't been women we'd still be squatting in a cave eating raw meat, because we made civilization in order to impress our girlfriends.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what's for lunch.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Popularity should be no scale for the election of politicians. If it would depend on popularity, Donald Duck and The Muppets would take seats in senate.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: The enemy of art is the absence of limitations.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Nobody who takes on anything big and tough can afford to be modest.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Everything about me is a contradiction, and so is everything about everybody else. We are made out of oppositions; we live between two poles. There's a philistine and an aesthete in all of us, and a murderer and a saint. You don't reconcile the poles. You just recognize them.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Race hate isn't human nature; race hate is the abandonment of human nature.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Living in the lap of luxury isn't bad except that you never know when luxury is going to stand up.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Now I'm an old Christmas tree, the roots of which have died. They just come along and while the little needles fall off me replace them with medallions.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: A good artist should be isolated. If he isn't isolated, something is wrong.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: When you are down and out something always turns up - and it is usually the noses of your friends.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: They teach anything in universities today. You can major in mud pies.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: The notion of directing a film is the invention of critics - the whole eloquence of cinema is achieved in the editing room.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Did you ever stop to think why cops are always famous for being dumb? Simple. Because they don't have to be anything else.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I have the terrible feeling that, because I am wearing a white beard and am sitting in the back of the theatre, you expect me to tell you the truth about something. These are the cheap seats, not Mount Sinai.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I've spent most of my mature life trying to prove that I'm not irresponsible.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I don't say we all ought to misbehave, but we ought to look as if we could.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I was spoiled in a very strange way as a child, because everybody told me, from the moment I was able to hear, that I was absolutely marvelous, and I never heard a discouraging word for years, you see. I didn't know what was ahead of me.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: I have a great love and respect for religion, great love and respect for atheism. What I hate is agnosticism, people who do not choose.
values.author: Orson Welles

values.authorQuote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Everything popular is wrong.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: I can resist everything except temptation.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Women are made to be loved, not understood.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: True friends stab you in the front.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: To expect the unexpected shows a thoroughly modern intellect.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: A man can be happy with any woman, as long as he does not love her.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: If a work of art is rich and vital and complete, those who have artistic instincts will see its beauty, and those to whom ethics appeal more strongly than aesthetics will see its moral lesson. It will fill the cowardly with terror, and the unclean will see in it their own shame.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: In America the President reigns for four years, and Journalism governs forever and ever.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: Beauty is the only thing that time cannot harm. Philosophies fall away like sand, creeds follow one another, but what is beautiful is a joy for all seasons, a possession for all eternity.
values.author: Oscar Wilde

values.authorQuote: The world is being run by irresponsible spoiled brats.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Global warming is a fact. Now it's up to liberals to make it a reality. Hence there is crucial importance in preventing powerful, greedy free market forces from getting in the way of worsening storms and rising sea levels. The Kyoto Accord is a good first step.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Freedom is not empowerment. Empowerment is what the Serbs have in Bosnia. Anybody can grab a gun and be empowered.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Never fight an inanimate object.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: We've come into the world of '1984,' but it turns out to be '1984'-Lite.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Adam Smith pointed out that there were three things that make us more prosperous, in a general sort of way: freedom to pursue our own self-interest; specialization, which he called division of labor; and freedom of trade.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: I think it's been hard for people to understand how Islam can be a good religion, and yet the Islamists are evil. Those of us who have had experience with Islam understand this, just as we understand the difference between snake handlers and people going to church on Sunday morning.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Being a humorist is not a voluntary thing. You can tell this because in a situation where saying a funny thing will cause a lot of trouble, a humorist will still say the funny thing. No matter how inappropriate.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: I like making things. I have a wood shop at home. I am a terrible carpenter but I love doing it.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Sheep farming is heavily subsidized in Great Britain. Without the subsidies, the green grazing in the valley of the River Exe would be gone. The handsome agricultural landscape of which the British are so proud, carefully husbanded since Boudicca's day, would be replaced by natural growth. The most likely growth is real-estate developments.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Each child is biologically required to have a mother. Fatherhood is a well-regarded theory, but motherhood is a fact.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: The Democrats are the party that says government will make you smarter, taller, richer, and remove the crabgrass on your lawn. The Republicans are the party that says government doesn't work and then they get elected and prove it.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Infant mortality and life expectancy are reasonable indicators of general well-being in a society.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: You can learn all about the human condition from covering the crime beat in a big city - you don't need to go to Beirut for that - but a foreign correspondent begins to understand poverty from a different perspective.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: A friend of mine at the American Enterprise Institute says there are two parties: the silly party and the stupid party. I'm too old for the silly party, so I had to join the stupid party.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: America gives every appearance of being a nation besotted with trashiness - divorce, illegitimacy, casual Fridays.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Some day you will be wheeled in for a heart bypass operation, and a surgeon will be the person who is now behind the counter when you renew your car registration at the department of motor vehicles.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Public schools helped create the idea of America and inculcate Americans with a few rudiments of knowledge. To judge by that very American item, the Internet, a few rudiments is all anyone cares to have.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Russians not only vehemently despise blacks, they believe Africa begins at the Ukraine border.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: The great thing about being a print journalist is that you are permitted to duck. Cameramen get killed while the writers are flat on the floor. A war correspondent for the BBC dedicated his memoir to 50 fallen colleagues, and I guarantee you they were all taking pictures. I am only alive because I am such a chicken.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: If we heard that somebody starved to death in Sweden or Switzerland, we would be shocked.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Never be unfaithful to a lover, except with your wife.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Think what evil creeps liberals would be if their plans to enfeeble the individual, exhaust the economy, impede the rule of law, and cripple national defense were guided by a coherent ideology instead of smug ignorance.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: There is a simple rule here, a rule of legislation, a rule of business, a rule of life: beyond a certain point, complexity is fraud. You can apply that rule to left-wing social programs, but you can also apply that rule to credit derivatives, hedge funds, all the rest of it.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: The perpetuation of slavery, the exile and extermination of American Indians, and the passage of Jim Crow laws weren't carried out at the bidding of a few malefactors of great wealth.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: Not much was really invented during the Renaissance, if you don't count modern civilization.
values.author: P. J. O'Rourke

values.authorQuote: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: It takes a long time to become young.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Youth has no age.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: My mother said to me, 'If you are a soldier, you will become a general. If you are a monk, you will become the Pope.' Instead, I was a painter, and became Picasso.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Colors, like features, follow the changes of the emotions.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Everything you can imagine is real.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso
