values.authorQuote: Good artists copy, great artists steal.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: The chief enemy of creativity is 'good' sense.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: I'd like to live as a poor man with lots of money.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: I do not seek. I find.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: There are only two types of women - goddesses and doormats.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: The world today doesn't make sense, so why should I paint pictures that do?
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Inspiration exists, but it has to find us working.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: Why do two colors, put one next to the other, sing? Can one really explain this? no. Just as one can never learn how to paint.
values.author: Pablo Picasso
values.authorOccupation: Painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet, playwright
values.authorBirthname: Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

values.authorQuote: America is hope. It is compassion. It is excellence. It is valor.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: We are a continuum. Just as we reach back to our ancestors for our fundamental values, so we, as guardians of that legacy, must reach ahead to our children and their children. And we do so with a sense of sacredness in that reaching.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Journey with me to a true commitment to our environment. Journey with me to the serenity of leaving to our children a planet in equilibrium.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: I am an American. I love this country.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: No one on his deathbed ever said, I wish I had spent more time on my business.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Let's try winning and see what it feels like. If we don't like it, we can go back to our traditions.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: This land, this water, this air, this planet - this is our legacy to our young.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Our only weapons in this war of your lifetime are the weapons of the mind.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: You are part of that horrid expression, the best and the brightest. It can be a terrible burden if you let it be, but it is the great challenge of your time. And being a warrior in that challenge should be wondrous.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: No one is immune from the larger events of his or her time - the Depression, World War II, civil rights, Vietnam, the spring of 1989 in China. These events intrude upon our lives and radically affect our directions.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: A commencement is a time of joy. It is also a time of melancholy. But then again, so is life.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: I want to deploy the leadership to meet the challenges that face us and to restore America's greatness.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Don't fear your mortality, because it is this very mortality that gives meaning and depth and poignancy to all the days that will be granted to you.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: That's a good question. Let me try to evade you.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: When George Bush used the Willie Horton ad, he knew what he was doing.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: I have pretty much made up my mind to do this.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Two hundred years ago, our Founding Fathers gave us a democracy. It was based upon the simple, yet noble, idea that government derives its validity from the consent of the governed.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: You are Americans. You love this country. Together we are entrusted with the principles that represent mankind's greatest political and social achievement.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Our destiny is greatness and we must return to its fulfillment.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Thinking in generations also means enabling our young to have a decent standard of living.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: That sense of sacredness, that thinking in generations, must begin with reverence for this earth.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: From a viable economy to the full funding of Headstart, from a clean environment to true equality for women, from a strong military to a commitment to racial brotherhood, from schools that are honored to streets free of excessive violence.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Seven and half years ago I began my own journey. For me and my family it was a time of adversity. But during that adversity I derived a deeper faith. And born out of that adversity was a commitment to devote myself to those people and to those issues that truly matter to me.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: America is the sum of all our journeys as we search for our national community and our national culture.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: In this era of the global village, the tide of democracy is running. And it will not cease, not in China, not in South Africa, not in any corner of this earth, where the simple idea of democracy and freedom has taken root.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: It was a myth that's often perpetuated at commencement that holds that only hope and promise lie beyond the halls of academe. Don't worry, be happy. Everything is fine.
values.author: Paul Tsongas

values.authorQuote: Sometimes the hurdles aren't really hurdles at all. They're welcome challenges, tests.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: My philosophy is: If you can't have fun, there's no sense in doing it.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I live by 'Go big or go home.' That's with everything. It's like either commit and go for it or don't do it at all. I apply that to everything. I apply that to relationships, I apply that to like sports, I apply that to everything. That's what I live by. That's how I like it.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: Surfing big waves is not an extreme sport to me. I fall off, tumble down, and come up. My heart's racing because I'm thinking I almost drowned, and I thank God I can breathe again, but I always think, 'What am I hitting?' Water.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: Surfing soothes me, it's always been a kind of Zen experience for me. The ocean is so magnificent, peaceful, and awesome. The rest of the world disappears for me when I'm on a wave.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I think my mom put it best. She said, 'Little girls soften their daddy's hearts.'
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I'm not afraid of anything. That's just the way I am.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: Thing is, I went to a born-again Christian high school, was brought up in a traditional Mormon family where these ideas about parenting are of structure and sacrifice. To think outside of that idea of family and parenting that I've grown up with is tough but also very freeing.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: It's not about working anymore, its about doing work I can be proud of.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: If you spend any time with a man, you'll realize that we're all still little boys.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I don't care what it is in life: listen to your heart. If you do, no matter what, you win.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: My mom's hot. I mean she's old, but my mom's out of control.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I have an airplane hangar with 17 cars in it. That's no joke. I have a 'half pipe' in there, too - you know, like a big ramp, where I skateboard. It's awesome. It's the ultimate fantasy.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: There's a lot of guys that just get comfortable with their positions and rest on their laurels. I had to earn my way.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I remember when I first came around, the computer-generated stuff was pretty wicked. I was like, 'Wow!' but I feel like then for the longest time, we saw so much of it, after a while, you might as well just be watching an animated movie.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I almost sabotaged my career. 'The Fast and the Furious' didn't let me, and I'm grateful now. That franchise gave me the opportunity.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: In college, my friends called me Mr. James Bond 007 because I entertained everything: blonds, brunettes, redheads. I'm across the board.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: You know, all that really matters is that the people you love are happy and healthy. Everything else is just sprinkles on the sundae.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: The dream is to have it all. Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too? Live this life, that life, this life, you know? You only live one time - I want to get it all in.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I've always wanted to race cars, ever since I was a young boy, as I think a lot of guys have.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I'm a crazy car guy. I've got an airplane hangar full of cars.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: Attitude is attitude, whether you're a West Coast gangster or East Coast gangster, you know?
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: When I was younger, the pressure was just being cool. I never thought of myself as a cool guy. I always thought of myself as more of the goofy guy.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I'm a science guy. I'm a geek. I love geology and botany and marine science. I thought maybe I'd be a professional guide, or maybe even a park ranger, working for the Department of Fish and Game.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I wish I could be behind the wheel for every stunt.
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I'm a doer, and whether it was the tsunami in Sri Lanka or the earthquake in Indonesia, I was always saying, 'I should be there; I should be helping out.'
values.author: Paul Walker

values.authorQuote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Culture makes people understand each other better. And if they understand each other better in their soul, it is easier to overcome the economic and political barriers. But first they have to understand that their neighbour is, in the end, just like them, with the same problems, the same questions.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: I can control my destiny, but not my fate. Destiny means there are opportunities to turn right or left, but fate is a one-way street. I believe we all have the choice as to whether we fulfil our destiny, but our fate is sealed.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: No one can lie, no one can hide anything, when he looks directly into someone's eyes.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worse kind of suffering.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Remember your dreams and fight for them. You must know what you want from life. There is just one thing that makes your dream become impossible: the fear of failure.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Love is a trap. When it appears, we see only its light, not its shadows.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: The good old days, when each idea had an owner, are gone forever.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: I cry very easily. It can be a movie, a phone conversation, a sunset - tears are words waiting to be written.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: You can become blind by seeing each day as a similar one. Each day is a different one, each day brings a miracle of its own. It's just a matter of paying attention to this miracle.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: I write from my soul. This is the reason that critics don't hurt me, because it is me. If it was not me, if I was pretending to be someone else, then this could unbalance my world, but I know who I am.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Let us be absolutely clear about one thing: we must not confuse humility with false modesty or servility.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: The wise are wise only because they love. The fool are fools only because they think they can understand love.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dream.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Everything that happens once can never happen again. But everything that happens twice will surely happen a third time.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: No, I never saw an angel, but it is irrelevant whether I saw one or not. I feel their presence around me.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: When a person really desires something, all the universe conspires to help that person to realize his dream.
values.author: Paulo Coelho

values.authorQuote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: I always had a philosophy which I got from my father. He used to say, 'Listen. God gave to you the gift to play football. This is your gift from God. If you take care of your health, if you are in good shape all the time, with your gift from God no one will stop you, but you must be prepared.'
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: I am constantly being asked about individuals. The only way to win is as a team. Football is not about one or two or three star players.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Enthusiasm is everything. It must be taut and vibrating like a guitar string.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Everything is practice.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Brazil eats, sleeps and drinks football. It lives football!
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: I have to trust something that gives me power; I have to believe in something, but in my career I have a lot of moments I cannot explain with God.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: The level of football in England is the top. English football is the leader in the world.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: When I was a footballer, I surrounded myself with footballers. We were all friends. But in Brasilia you don't know who your friends are. It can be a dangerous place.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: The first World Cup I remember was in the 1950 when I was 9 or 10 years old. My father was a soccer player, and there was a big party, and when Brazil lost to Uruguay, I saw my father crying.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: The World Cup is a very complicated tournament - six games, seven if you make it to the final - and maybe if you lose one game you're out, even if you're the best.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Yes, I have a lot of business interests. But I don't work for just anyone, and I choose the companies very carefully.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: The World Cup is a very important way to measure the good players, and the great ones. It is a test of a great player.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: The bicycle kick is not easy to do. I scored 1,283 goals, and only two or three were bicycle kicks.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: When I retired, at that time I had a lot of proposals to play in Europe, England, Italy, Spain, Mexico. But I said no, after 18 years I want to rest, because I want to retire.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Sport is something that is very inspirational for young people.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Brazil's always had great players, both at home and abroad, but we need to put all that talent together and mould a team out of it.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: A lot of people, when a guy scores a lot of goals, think, 'He's a great player', because a goal is very important, but a great player is a player who can do everything on the field. He can do assists, encourage his colleagues, give them confidence to go forward. It is someone who, when a team does not do well, becomes one of the leaders.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: I represent Brazil all over the world. Wherever I go I have to do my best, to not disappoint the Brazilian people. And that I've done.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: When you play against dirty players or very tough players, it's easy to escape because you know what they're going to do. But when the player is tough but intelligent, it's much more difficult.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: I've come to accept that the life of a frontrunner is a hard one, that he will suffer more injuries than most men and that many of these injuries will not be accidental.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: A penalty is a cowardly way to score.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Lionel Messi is a wonderful player. Very skillful. Highly intelligent. He is not good in the air.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: If you don't give education to people, it is easy to manipulate them.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Everybody knows my life. I won a lot of tournaments and scored more than 1,000 goals, won three World Cups but I could not play in Olympic Games.
values.author: Pele

values.authorQuote: Memorial Day isn't just about honoring veterans, its honoring those who lost their lives. Veterans had the fortune of coming home. For us, that's a reminder of when we come home we still have a responsibility to serve. It's a continuation of service that honors our country and those who fell defending it.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: At Concerned Veterans for America, we've made the case that the defense budget could be targeted for spending reform, but in a targeted fashion that genuinely changes unsustainable spending trajectories while preserving U.S. defense capacity.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: As an infantry officer who served in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Guantanamo Bay, I have led men in combat and trained them on tactics and strategy. The mission of the infantry is to 'close with, and destroy, the enemy.' Our job, in a direct way, is to fight and win wars.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: The historic nature of Israel's struggle for self-determination, freedom, and prosperity underscores the gravity of their circumstances and fortifies my commitment to America's responsibility as their ally.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Veterans are driven by the same frustrations that the public has with what is happening in Washington... the fiscal irresponsibility and the financial crisis that our country is facing.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: President Lincoln chose to fight a bloody and unpopular war because he believed the enemy had to be defeated. He was right.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Concerned Veterans for America (CVA) has called for an audit of the Pentagon, so that we finally have some transparency and accountability in how DOD spends taxpayer dollars.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: As an observer, I react to the realities of Israeli life with both envy and relief. Nobody wants to live under the threat of constant attack from enemies right next door, under ceaseless and often unfair international scrutiny, defending his homeland by day and living with the memories of mass genocide at night.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: The choices Israelis face and the decisions they make, day in and day out, are literally the difference between life and death. In many ways, I liken their reactions to the way I felt while serving in Iraq.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Peace through strength works; but the flip side is war invited by weakness.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: I believe, if done correctly, eliminating Saddam and liberating Iraq could be the 'Normandy Invasion' or 'fall of the Berlin Wall' of our generation... the Iraqi people are eager to be rid of Saddam, and there is equally encouraging evidence that republican principles could thrive there.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: In the 360-degree battlefields of Iraq and Afghanistan, women have served honorably and fought valiantly. Yet there is a key difference between being in harm's way and reacting to enemy contact, and being in a direct combat operations role day in and day out. They are different scenarios that require different standards.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Defense leaders should be searching for ways to reform out-of-date procurement processes, to collapse layers of Pentagon bureaucracy, and to restrain the growth in personnel and benefits costs. A critical first step in that process should be to conduct a full Pentagon audit to determine how DOD spends taxpayer dollars.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: With the winding down of the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, the United States now has an opportunity to implement real defense reforms without having a serious impact on immediate battlefield needs.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Military deployments have never been something to enjoy, but the consequence of the actions, the shared nature of the sacrifices, and the nobility of the cause are invigorating. To be clear, I'm not talking about the killing and the death; rather, the sense of purpose that pervades every action, reaction, and outcome.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: As the publisher of the 'Tory,' I strive to defend the pillars of Western civilization against the distractions of diversity.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Being a defense hawk and a budget hawk are not mutually exclusive.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Political correctness is a poison to our security and defenses. It imposes a willful blindness, both at the macro level when unwilling to engage with radical Islamism or whatever you want to call it - if you're not willing to call it what it is - and at the micro level, at the street level.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: I think standing and fighting and working alongside all of these people that raise their right hand and serve their nation... really wipes away the distractions of some of the petty things we think are important at home.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: When Mr. Obama entered office, he said all the right things about getting Washington spending under control. He even promised to cut the deficit in half by the end of his first term. Obviously, that didn't happen.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: It's a sense in Minnesota that we need to get back to common sense. We need to get back to taking sensible looks at positions and understanding the proper role of government.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Combat duty is strenuous and physically demanding, and I'm not the first person to notice that men and women are built differently. And while many will argue that women will only be allowed into combat arms units under the same requirements as their male counterparts, count me as skeptical.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Whether we like it or not, gender differences matter in a combat situation.
values.author: Pete Hegseth

values.authorQuote: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Rank does not confer privilege or give power. It imposes responsibility.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: The aim of marketing is to know and understand the customer so well the product or service fits him and sells itself.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: We now accept the fact that learning is a lifelong process of keeping abreast of change. And the most pressing task is to teach people how to learn.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Most of what we call management consists of making it difficult for people to get their work done.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Unless commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes... but no plans.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Few companies that installed computers to reduce the employment of clerks have realized their expectations... They now need more, and more expensive clerks even though they call them 'operators' or 'programmers.'
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Business, that's easily defined - it's other people's money.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Today knowledge has power. It controls access to opportunity and advancement.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Executives owe it to the organization and to their fellow workers not to tolerate nonperforming individuals in important jobs.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: When a subject becomes totally obsolete we make it a required course.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Checking the results of a decision against its expectations shows executives what their strengths are, where they need to improve, and where they lack knowledge or information.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Teaching is the only major occupation of man for which we have not yet developed tools that make an average person capable of competence and performance. In teaching we rely on the 'naturals', the ones who somehow know how to teach.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: My greatest strength as a consultant is to be ignorant and ask a few questions.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: The new information technology... Internet and e-mail... have practically eliminated the physical costs of communications.
values.author: Peter Drucker

values.authorQuote: Sometimes you make the right decision, sometimes you make the decision right.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: It's better to be healthy alone than sick with someone else.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: We all have a social mask, right? We put it on, we go out, put our best foot forward, our best image. But behind that social mask is a personal truth, what we really, really believe about who we are and what we're capable of.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: I'm one of those that believes you can't be one kind of a man and another kind of president.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Sometimes you just got to give yourself what you wish someone else would give you.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: There's a big difference between falling in love and being in love. There's a big difference between infatuation and falling in love.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: You're only lonely if you're not there for you.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: The problem is that for women, the average time is just over 14 minutes... men are left with about 12 minutes during which time they need to think of something to do!
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Everyone faces the challenge of finding meaning to their suffering.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: I do not believe, even remotely, that you have to have a partner in your life in order to be whole, in order to be complete, in order to be fulfilled. You just don't have to.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Eighty percent of all choices are based on fear. Most people don't choose what they want; they choose what they think is safe.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: I mean, if you degrade someone, you isolate them, you control them, you call them names, you demean them. That's a horrible existence for people.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: My dad used to say, 'You wouldn't worry so much about what people thought about you if you knew how seldom they did.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Successful weight loss takes programming, not willpower.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: You have got to decide, look, this is who I am; this is my best way to present myself, and I'm going to ride that horse to the finish line. Not everybody will like it, but that's OK.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: It's great if the in-laws themselves put up boundaries. But if they won't; it's up to their grown kids to do it and enforce them.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: A lot of people do have tragic childhoods. But you know what? Get over it.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Oh, everybody wears a mask. We all put our best foot forward. We all try and make a statement, I'm not saying that's bad.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: You don't need a pack of wild horses to learn how to make a sandwich.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Take it from a guy: If you're in love with somebody, you will swim the stream, you will climb the mountain, you will slay the dragon. You're going to get to her somehow, some way.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: You don't need a rope to pinch a stranger's butt.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Don't wait until you're in a crisis to come up with a crisis plan.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: Awareness without action is worthless.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: I mean, look, teachers don't do their job for the money, obviously, because we pay them ridiculously little amounts for what they put in. Most of them come out of their own pocket for materials and things to help the children and all that.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: I'm embarrassed every time I look a teacher in the eye, because we ask them to do so much for so little.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: If your neighbor has a completely different view on abortion, gay marriage, stem cell research, all of those things, you still are both Americans. Neither one of you is necessarily more patriotic than the other. Neither loves their country any more than the other one does.
values.author: Phil McGraw

values.authorQuote: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of one's self to others.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Love is an adventure and a conquest. It survives and develops, like the universe itself, only by perpetual discovery.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: We spend our lives, all of us, waiting for the great day, the great battle, or the deed of power. But that external consummation is not given to many: nor is it necessary. So long as our being is tensed, directed with passion, towards that which is the spirit of all things, then that spirit will emerge from our own hidden, nameless effort.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Love is a sacred reserve of energy; it is like the blood of spiritual evolution.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Through fidelity, we situate ourselves and maintain ourselves in the hands of God so exactly as to become one with them in their action.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Love is the affinity which links and draws together the elements of the world... Love, in fact, is the agent of universal synthesis.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Being happy is a matter of personal taste.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: It doesn't matter if the water is cold or warm if you're going to have to wade through it anyway.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Nothing can resist the person who smiles at life - I don't mean the ironic and disillusioned smile of my grandfather, but the triumphant smile of the person who knows that he will survive, or that at least he will be saved by what seems to be destroying him.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Growing old is like being increasingly penalized for a crime you haven't committed.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Love alone is capable of uniting living beings in such a way as to complete and fulfill them, for it alone takes them and joins them by what is deepest in themselves.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: We are one, after all, you and I, together we suffer, together exist and forever will recreate each other.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Is evolution a theory, a system, or an hypothesis? It is much more: it is a general condition to which all theories, all hypotheses, all systems must bow and which they must satisfy henceforward if they are to be thinkable and true.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Everywhere on Earth, at this moment, in the new spiritual atmosphere created by the appearance of the idea of evolution, there float, in a state of extreme mutual sensitivity, love of God and faith in the world: the two essential components of the Ultra-human.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: To discover and know has always been a deep tendency of our nature. Can we not recognize it already in caveman?
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Death is acceptable only if it represents the physically necessary passage toward a union, the condition of a metamorphosis.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: It is our duty as men and women to proceed as though the limits of our abilities do not exist.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: In the final analysis, the questions of why bad things happen to good people transmutes itself into some very different questions, no longer asking why something happened, but asking how we will respond, what we intend to do now that it happened.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Man can be understood only by ascending from physics, chemistry, biology, and geology. In other words, he is first of all a cosmic problem.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Have you ever thought how humiliating and distressing it was to be placed upon a sphere? For friendship it is a boon never to be able to be further apart than the antipodes. But suppose that you are leaving together to go on and on; it is impossible. To go beyond a certain point is to return to where you began.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: The universe as we know it is a joint product of the observer and the observed.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Driven by the forces of love, the fragments of the world seek each other so that the world may come to being.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: The earth was probably born by accident; but, in accordance with one of the most general laws of evolution, scarcely had this accident happened than it was immediately made use of and recast into something naturally directed.
values.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
values.authorOccupation: Idealist philosopher, Jesuit priest, paleontologist, geologist

values.authorQuote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: Dictatorship naturally arises out of democracy, and the most aggravated form of tyranny and slavery out of the most extreme liberty.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
values.author: Plato
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, founder of the Academy in Athens

values.authorQuote: If a man neglects education, he walks lame to the end of his life.

values.authorQuote: Even today we raise our hand against our brother... We have perfected our weapons, our conscience has fallen asleep, and we have sharpened our ideas to justify ourselves as if it were normal we continue to sow destruction, pain, death. Violence and war lead only to death.

values.authorQuote: Human rights are not only violated by terrorism, repression or assassination, but also by unfair economic structures that creates huge inequalities.

values.authorQuote: We must restore hope to young people, help the old, be open to the future, spread love. Be poor among the poor. We need to include the excluded and preach peace.

values.authorQuote: Life is a journey. When we stop, things don't go right.

values.authorQuote: Each of us has a vision of good and of evil. We have to encourage people to move towards what they think is good... Everyone has his own idea of good and evil and must choose to follow the good and fight evil as he conceives them. That would be enough to make the world a better place.
values.author: Pope Francis

values.authorQuote: Together with a culture of work, there must be a culture of leisure as gratification. To put it another way: people who work must take the time to relax, to be with their families, to enjoy themselves, read, listen to music, play a sport.

values.authorQuote: An example I often use to illustrate the reality of vanity, is this: look at the peacock; it's beautiful if you look at it from the front. values.authorQuote: A person who thinks only about building walls, wherever they may be, and not building bridges is not Christian. This is not in the Gospel.

values.authorQuote: If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge? We shouldn't marginalise people for this. They must be integrated into society.

values.authorQuote: A little bit of mercy makes the world less cold and more just.

values.authorQuote: Since many of you do not belong to the Catholic Church and others are non-believers, from the bottom of my heart I give this silent blessing to each and every one of you, respecting the conscience of each one of you but knowing that each one of you is a child of God.

values.authorQuote: Sin, also for those who don't have faith, exists when one goes against one's conscience. To listen to and obey it means, in fact, to decide in face of what is perceived as good or evil. And on this decision pivots the goodness or malice of our action.

values.authorQuote: We all have the duty to do good.

values.authorQuote: The worship of the golden calf of old has found a new and heartless image in the cult of money and the dictatorship of an economy which is faceless and lacking any truly human goal.

values.authorQuote: Those who today always look for disciplinarian solutions, those who long for an exaggerated doctrinal 'security,' those who stubbornly try to recover a past that no longer exists - they have a static and inward-directed view of things. values.authorQuote: Christmas is joy, religious joy, an inner joy of light and peace.

values.authorQuote: Jesus teaches us another way: Go out. Go out and share your testimony, go out and interact with your brothers, go out and share, go out and ask. Become the Word in body as well as spirit.

values.authorQuote: Tell me: when God looks at a gay person, does he endorse the existence of this person with love, or reject and condemn this person?... It is necessary to accompany them with mercy.

values.authorQuote: This is important: to get to know people, listen, expand the circle of ideas. The world is crisscrossed by roads that come closer together and move apart, but the important thing is that they lead towards the Good.

values.authorQuote: Wretched are those who are vindictive and spiteful.

values.authorQuote: I know of no single formula for success. values.authorQuote: At its heart, engineering is about using science to find creative, practical solutions. It is a noble profession.

values.authorQuote: Grief is the price we pay for love.

values.authorQuote: Therefore I am sure that this, my Coronation, is not the symbol of a power and a splendor that are gone but a declaration of our hopes for the future, and for the years I may, by God's Grace and Mercy, be given to reign and serve you as your Queen.

values.authorQuote: The lessons from the peace process are clear; whatever life throws at us, our individual responses will be all the stronger for working together and sharing the load.

values.authorQuote: I have in sincerity pledged myself to your service, as so many of you are pledged to mine. Throughout all my life and with all my heart I shall strive to be worthy of your trust.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: To all those who have suffered as a consequence of our troubled past I extend my sincere thoughts and deep sympathy. With the benefit of historical hindsight we can all see things which we would wish had been done differently or not at all.

values.authorQuote: I declare before you all that my whole life, whether it be long or short, shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong.

values.authorQuote: First, I want to pay tribute to Diana myself. She was an exceptional and gifted human being. In good times and bad, she never lost her capacity to smile and laugh, nor to inspire others with her warmth and kindness. I admired and respected her - for her energy and commitment to others, and especially for her devotion to her two boys.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: It is easy enough to define what the Commonwealth is not. Indeed this is quite a popular pastime.

values.authorQuote: I have behind me not only the splendid traditions and the annals of more than a thousand years but the living strength and majesty of the Commonwealth and Empire; of societies old and new; of lands and races different in history and origins but all, by God's Will, united in spirit and in aim.

values.authorQuote: The events that I have attended to mark my Diamond Jubilee have been a humbling experience. It has touched me deeply to see so many thousands of families, neighbors and friends celebrating together in such a happy atmosphere.

values.authorQuote: At Christmas, I am always struck by how the spirit of togetherness lies also at the heart of the Christmas story. A young mother and a dutiful father with their baby were joined by poor shepherds and visitors from afar. They came with their gifts to worship the Christ child.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: My husband has quite simply been my strength and stay all these years, and I owe him a debt greater than he would ever claim.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: I have been aware all the time that my peoples, spread far and wide throughout every continent and ocean in the world, were united to support me in the task to which I have now been dedicated with such solemnity.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: I have to be seen to be believed.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: For many, Christmas is also a time for coming together. But for others, service will come first.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: I myself prefer my New Zealand eggs for breakfast.
values.author: Queen Elizabeth II

values.authorQuote: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Integrity is the essence of everything successful.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Pollution is nothing but the resources we are not harvesting. We allow them to disperse because we've been ignorant of their value.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty but when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: One in ten thousand of us can make a technological breakthrough capable of supporting all the rest. The youth of today are absolutely right in recognizing this nonsense of earning a wage.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: A designer is an emerging synthesis of artist, inventor, mechanic, objective economist and evolutionary strategist.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: People should think things out fresh and not just accept conventional terms and the conventional way of doing things.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: I'm not a genius. I'm just a tremendous bundle of experience.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Love is metaphysical gravity.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: I just invent, then wait until man comes around to needing what I've invented.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: How often I found where I should be going only by setting out for somewhere else.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Don't fight forces, use them.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: God is a verb, not a noun.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: My ideas have undergone a process of emergence by emergency. When they are needed badly enough, they are accepted.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: What usually happens in the educational process is that the faculties are dulled, overloaded, stuffed and paralyzed so that by the time most people are mature they have lost their innate capabilities.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Nature is trying very hard to make us succeed, but nature does not depend on us. We are not the only experiment.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: I look for what needs to be done. After all, that's how the universe designs itself.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Sometimes I think we're alone. Sometimes I think we're not. In either case, the thought is staggering.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Dictators never invent their own opportunities.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Parents are usually more careful to bestow knowledge on their children rather than virtue, the art of speaking well rather than doing well; but their manners should be of the greatest concern.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: We are called to be architects of the future, not its victims.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Let architects sing of aesthetics that bring Rich clients in hordes to their knees; Just give me a home, in a great circle dome Where stresses and strains are at ease.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: The end move in politics is always to pick up a gun.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Great nations are simply the operating fronts of behind-the-scenes, vastly ambitious individuals who had become so effectively powerful because of their ability to remain invisible while operating behind the national scenery.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Ninety-nine percent of who you are is invisible and untouchable.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: We are not going to be able to operate our Spaceship Earth successfully nor for much longer unless we see it as a whole spaceship and our fate as common. It has to be everybody or nobody.
values.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

values.authorQuote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
values.author: Rabindranath Tagore
values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.

values.authorQuote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
values.author: Rabindranath Tagore
values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
values.author: Rabindranath Tagore
values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
values.author: Rabindranath Tagore
values.authorOccupation: Writer, song composer, playwright, essayist, painter

values.authorQuote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
