values.authorQuote: The fact that life evolved out of nearly nothing, some 10 billion years after the universe evolved out of literally nothing, is a fact so staggering that I would be mad to attempt words to do it justice.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: Christopher Hitchens was a great warrior, a magnificent orator, a pugilist and a gentleman. He was kind, but he took no prisoners when arguing with idiots.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: Religion is capable of driving people to such dangerous folly that faith seems to me to qualify as a kind of mental illness.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: From a Darwinian perspective, it is clear what pain is doing. It's a warning: 'Don't do that again.' If you burn yourself, you're never going to pick up a live coal again.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: Secularism is categorically not saying that the religious may not speak out publicly or have a say in public life. It is about saying that religion alone should not confer a privileged say in public life, or greater influence on it. It really is as simple as that.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: Design can never be an ultimate explanation for anything. It can only be a proximate explanation. A plane or a car is explained by a designer but that's because the designer himself, the engineer, is explained by natural selection.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: If something is true, no amount of wishful thinking will change it.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: An Internet meme is a hijacking of the original idea. Instead of mutating by random change and spreading by a form of Darwinian selection, Internet memes are altered deliberately by human creativity. There is no attempt at accuracy of copying, as with genes - and as with memes in their original version.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: We should take astrology seriously. No, I don't mean we should believe in it. I am talking about fighting it seriously instead of humouring it as a piece of harmless fun.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: The theory of evolution by cumulative natural selection is the only theory we know of that is in principle capable of explaining the existence of organized complexity.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: Even if you believe a creator god invented the laws of physics, would you so insult him as to suggest that he might capriciously and arbitrarily violate them in order to walk on water, or turn water into wine as a cheap party trick at a wedding?
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: The very idea of supernatural magic - including miracles - is incoherent, devoid of sensible meaning.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: I do sometimes accuse people of ignorance, but that is not intended to be an insult. I'm ignorant of lots of things. Ignorance is something that can be remedied by education.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: God exists, if only in the form of a meme with high survival value, or infective power, in the environment provided by human culture.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: The meme for blind faith secures its own perpetuation by the simple unconscious expedient of discouraging rational inquiry.
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: How can you take seriously someone who likes to believe something because he finds it 'comforting'?
values.author: Richard Dawkins

values.authorQuote: No event in American history is more misunderstood than the Vietnam War. It was misreported then, and it is misremembered now.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: The Cold War isn't thawing; it is burning with a deadly heat. Communism isn't sleeping; it is, as always, plotting, scheming, working, fighting.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: You must pursue this investigation of Watergate even if it leads to the president. I'm innocent. You've got to believe I'm innocent. If you don't, take my job.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: The finest steel has to go through the hottest fire.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: If you take no risks, you will suffer no defeats. But if you take no risks, you win no victories.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: In the long term we can hope that religion will change the nature of man and reduce conflict. But history is not encouraging in this respect. The bloodiest wars in history have been religious wars.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Only if you have been in the deepest valley, can you ever know how magnificent it is to be on the highest mountain.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Defeat doesn't finish a man, quit does. A man is not finished when he's defeated. He's finished when he quits.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Don't get the impression that you arouse my anger. You see, one can only be angry with those he respects.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: When the President does it, that means that it's not illegal.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: I have never been a quitter. To leave office before my term is completed is opposed to every instinct in my body. But as president I must put the interests of America first Therefore, I shall resign the presidency effective at noon tomorrow.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Life isn't meant to be easy. It's hard to take being on the top - or on the bottom. I guess I'm something of a fatalist. You have to have a sense of history, I think, to survive some of these things... Life is one crisis after another.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: It is necessary for me to establish a winner image. Therefore, I have to beat somebody.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: The press is the enemy.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: The greatest honor history can bestow is that of peacemaker.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Finishing second in the Olympics gets you silver. Finishing second in politics gets you oblivion.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Sure there are dishonest men in local government. But there are dishonest men in national government too.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: We are not spending the Federal Government's money, we are spending the taxpayer's money, and it must be spent n a way which guarantees his money's worth and yields the fullest possible benefit to the people being helped.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Voters quickly forget what a man says.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Remember, always give your best. Never get discouraged. Never be petty. Always remember, others may hate you. But those who hate you don't win unless you hate them. And then you destroy yourself.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: You must never be satisfied with losing. You must get angry, terribly angry, about losing. But the mark of the good loser is that he takes his anger out on himself and not his victorious opponents or on his teammates.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Well, I screwed it up real good, didn't I?
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: I can take it. The tougher it gets, the cooler I get.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: Let us move from the era of confrontation to the era of negotiation.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: We must always remember that America is a great nation today not because of what government did for people but because of what people did for themselves and for one another.
values.author: Richard M. Nixon

values.authorQuote: It doesn't matter how beautiful your theory is, it doesn't matter how smart you are. If it doesn't agree with experiment, it's wrong.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself and you are the easiest person to fool.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Scientific views end in awe and mystery, lost at the edge in uncertainty, but they appear to be so deep and so impressive that the theory that it is all arranged as a stage for God to watch man's struggle for good and evil seems inadequate.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: The internal machinery of life, the chemistry of the parts, is something beautiful. And it turns out that all life is interconnected with all other life.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: If I could explain it to the average person, I wouldn't have been worth the Nobel Prize.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: The thing that doesn't fit is the thing that's the most interesting: the part that doesn't go according to what you expected.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Once I get on a puzzle, I can't get off.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: What one fool can understand, another can.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns, so that each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: It's the way I study - to understand something by trying to work it out or, in other words, to understand something by creating it. Not creating it one hundred percent, of course; but taking a hint as to which direction to go but not remembering the details. These you work out for yourself.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: From the point of view of basic physics, the most interesting phenomena are, of course, in the new places, the places where the rules do not work - not the places where they do work! That is the way in which we discover new rules.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: If I get stuck, I look at a book that tells me how someone else did it. I turn the pages, and then I say, 'Oh, I forgot that bit,' then close the book and carry on. Finally, after you've figured out how to do it, you read how they did it and find out how dumb your solution is and how much more clever and efficient theirs is!
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Poets say science takes away from the beauty of the stars - mere globs of gas atoms. I, too, can see the stars on a desert night, and feel them. But do I see less or more?
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Until I began to learn to draw, I was never much interested in looking at art.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: It is necessary to look at the results of observation objectively, because you, the experimenter, might like one result better than another.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: The fact that the colors in the flower have evolved in order to attract insects to pollinate it is interesting; that means insects can see the colors. That adds a question: does this aesthetic sense we have also exist in lower forms of life?
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: See that the imagination of nature is far, far greater than the imagination of man.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: Things on a very small scale behave like nothing that you have any direct experience about. They do not behave like waves, they do not behave like particles, they do not behave like clouds, or billiard balls, or weights on springs, or like anything that you have ever seen.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: I think that when we know that we actually do live in uncertainty, then we ought to admit it; it is of great value to realize that we do not know the answers to different questions. This attitude of mind - this attitude of uncertainty - is vital to the scientist, and it is this attitude of mind which the student must first acquire.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: I don't know what's the matter with people: they don't learn by understanding; they learn by some other way - by rote, or something. Their knowledge is so fragile!
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: The idea is to try to give all the information to help others to judge the value of your contribution; not just the information that leads to judgment in one particular direction or another.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: It is in the admission of ignorance and the admission of uncertainty that there is a hope for the continuous motion of human beings in some direction that doesn't get confined, permanently blocked, as it has so many times before in various periods in the history of man.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: If we have an atom that is in an excited state and so is going to emit a photon, we cannot say when it will emit the photon. It has a certain amplitude to emit the photon at any time, and we can predict only a probability for emission; we cannot predict the future exactly.
values.author: Richard P. Feynman

values.authorQuote: I'm really looking forward to seeing what life brings to me.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I don't do things for the response or for the controversy. I just live my life.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: When you realize who you live for, and who's important to please, a lot of people will actually start living. I am never going to get caught up in that. I'm gonna look back on my life and say that I enjoyed it - and I lived it for me.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I always believed that when you follow your heart or your gut, when you really follow the things that feel great to you, you can never lose, because settling is the worst feeling in the world.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: The bottom line is that everyone thinks differently.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: When I am putting looks together, I dare myself to make something work. I always look for the most interesting silhouette or something that's a little off, but I have to figure it out. I have to make it me. I think that's the thrill in fashion.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: God just has a way of working things out the way he wants to and you have no say in that.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I'm crazy and I don't pretend to be anything else.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: If someone is right for you, you'll know it.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: My mother would kill me if I posed nude! My mother raised me with certain standards.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I am happy and I'm single.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: Single life is so overrated.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: You have to just accept your body. You may not love it all the way, but you just have to be comfortable with it, comfortable with knowing that that's your body.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I take risks because I get bored. And I get bored very easily.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: People take the little bit of information they're fed, and they draw a picture of who you are. Most of the time, it's wrong.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: If you don't live your life, then who will?
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: When I see myself as an old woman, I just think about being happy. And hopefully, I'll still be fly.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: Over the holidays, and even during filming, I realized that I actually like my body, even if it's not perfect according to the book. I just feel sexy. For the first time, I don't want to get rid of the curves. I just want to tone it up. My body is comfortable, and it's not unhealthy, so I'm going to rock with it.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I could never identify with that word, 'weak.'
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: You don't want to live your life and then meet someone. You want to share your life with someone. That's what I'm missing right now.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: If I cry, it's because I'm very angry and I can't do anything about it because I've run into a dead end. That's when the tears would come down.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: People think, because we're young, we aren't complex, but that's not true. We deal with life and love and broken hearts in the same way a woman a few years older might.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I have a lot of other stuff to accomplish before I get to kids. Whenever the time is right, I'll just know. If I had a girl, she'd probably be really rebellious. She would be like a bundle of karma. I would love to bring them up in Barbados.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I drink a lot of coconut water. It balances out all the other toxic stuff I put into my body.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: Whatever I'm feeling, whatever I'm going through, whatever mood I'm in... If I'm feeling like dancing or clubbing, then it will be reflected in the music. If I'm feeling dark and vulnerable, then it will reflect in the music, too.
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: I know that a large part of my fan base is gay. They've shown me love from the start. I mean in this industry, everyone from my glam people to my dancers are gay. You can't be homophobic in this line of work - I'm a pop star!
values.author: Rihanna
values.authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress

values.authorQuote: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Yield to temptation. It may not pass your way again.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Political tags - such as royalist, communist, democrat, populist, fascist, liberal, conservative, and so forth - are never basic criteria. The human race divides politically into those who want people to be controlled and those who have no such desire.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: I never learned from a man who agreed with me.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: The universe never did make sense; I suspect it was built on government contract.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: By cultivating the beautiful we scatter the seeds of heavenly flowers, as by doing good we cultivate those that belong to humanity.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: One of the sanest, surest, and most generous joys of life comes from being happy over the good fortune of others.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: When a place gets crowded enough to require ID's, social collapse is not far away. It is time to go elsewhere. The best thing about space travel is that it made it possible to go elsewhere.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Anyone who considers protocol unimportant has never dealt with a cat.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: They didn't want it good, they wanted it Wednesday.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Don't handicap your children by making their lives easy.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: You can have peace. Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Be wary of strong drink. It can make you shoot at tax collectors... and miss.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: There is no way that writers can be tamed and rendered civilized or even cured. The only solution known to science is to provide the patient with an isolation room, where he can endure the acute stages in private and where food can be poked in to him with a stick.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: For me, politeness is a sine qua non of civilization.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Don't ever become a pessimist... a pessimist is correct oftener than an optimist, but an optimist has more fun, and neither can stop the march of events.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: When any government, or any church for that matter, undertakes to say to its subjects, This you may not read, this you must not see, this you are forbidden to know, the end result is tyranny and oppression no matter how holy the motives.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Theology is never any help; it is searching in a dark cellar at midnight for a black cat that isn't there. Theologians can persuade themselves of anything.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: No statement should be believed because it is made by an authority.
values.author: Robert A. Heinlein
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]

values.authorQuote: Juvenile crime is not naturally born in the boy, but is largely due either to the spirit of adventure that is in him, to his own stupidity, or to his lack of discipline, according to the nature of the individual.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: I believe that God put us in this jolly world to be happy and enjoy life.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: We never fail when we try to do our duty, we always fail when we neglect to do it.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: A Scout smiles and whistles under all circumstances.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Be Prepared... the meaning of the motto is that a scout must prepare himself by previous thinking out and practicing how to act on any accident or emergency so that he is never taken by surprise.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: A Scout is never taken by surprise; he knows exactly what to do when anything unexpected happens.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: The most worth-while thing is to try to put happiness into the lives of others.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Happiness doesn't come from being rich, nor merely from being successful in your career, nor by self-indulgence. One step towards happiness is to make yourself healthy and strong while you are a boy so that you can be useful and so you can enjoy life when you are a man.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: An individual step in character training is to put responsibility on the individual.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Trust should be the basis for all our moral training.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Scoutcraft is a means through which the veriest hooligan can be brought to higher thought and to the elements of faith in God; and, coupled with the Scout's obligation to do a good turn every day, it gives the base of Duty to God and to Neighbour on which the parent or pastor can build with greater ease the form of belief that is desired.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: The spirit is there in every boy; it has to be discovered and brought to light.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: There are thousands of boys being wasted daily to our country through being left to become characterless, and, therefore, useless wasters, a misery to themselves and an eyesore and a danger to the nation. They could be saved if only the right surroundings or environment were given to them at the receptive time of their lives.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Nature study will show you how full of beautiful and wonderful things God has made the world for you to enjoy. Be contented with what you have got and make the best of it. Look on the bright side of things instead of the gloomy one.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Erudition - that is, reading, writing, and arithmetic - is taught in the schools; but where is the more important quality, character, taught? Nowhere in particular. There is no authorized training for children in character.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: If you make yourself indispensable to your employer, he is not going to part with you in a hurry no matter what it costs him.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Show me a poorly uniformed troop and I'll show you a poorly uniformed leader.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: If you are in the country, you should notice landmarks - that is, objects which help you to find your way or prevent you getting lost, such as distant hills, church towers, and nearer objects, such as peculiar buildings, trees, gates, rocks, etc.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Happiness is within the reach of everyone, rich or poor. Yet comparatively few people are happy. I believe the reason for this is that the majority don't recognize happiness even when it is within their grasp.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Success in training the boy depends largely on the Scoutmaster's own personal example.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: The more responsibility the Scoutmaster gives his patrol leaders, the more they will respond.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: To get a hold on boys you must be their friend.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: It always seems to me so odd that when a man dies, he takes out with him all the knowledge that he has got in his lifetime whilst sowing his wild oats or winning successes. And he leaves his sons or younger brothers to go through all the work of learning it over again from their own experience.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: A good boxing competition gives one the sight of fine men in their prime, trained to the ounce, showing the highest skill, pluck and endurance in carrying out their attack and defence under strict rules of fair play and good temper.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Life would pall if it were all sugar; salt is bitter if taken by itself; but when tasted as part of the dish, it savours the meat. Difficulties are the salt of life.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: Try and leave this world a little better than you found it, and when your turn comes to die, you can die happy in feeling that at any rate, you have not wasted your time but have done your best.
values.author: Robert Baden-Powell
values.authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys

values.authorQuote: In this enlightened age, there are few I believe, but what will acknowledge, that slavery as an institution is a moral & political evil in any country. It is useless to expatiate on its disadvantages.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: What a cruel thing war is... to fill our hearts with hatred instead of love for our neighbors.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: It is good that war is so horrible, or we might grow to like it.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: A Union that can only be maintained by swords and bayonets has no charm for me. If the Union is dissolved and government disrupted, I shall return to my native state and share the miseries of my people, and save in defense will draw my sword on none.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I have fought against the people of the North because I believed they were seeking to wrest from the South its dearest rights. But I have never cherished toward them bitter or vindictive feelings, and I have never seen the day when I did not pray for them.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: The education of a man is never completed until he dies.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: We failed, but in the good providence of God apparent failure often proves a blessing.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I like whiskey. I always did, and that is why I never drink it.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: Get correct views of life, and learn to see the world in its true light. It will enable you to live pleasantly, to do good, and, when summoned away, to leave without regret.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: If you have any fault to find with anyone, tell him, not others, of what you complain; there is no more dangerous experiment than that of undertaking to be one thing before a man's face and another behind his back.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: It is well that war is so terrible, otherwise we should grow too fond of it.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: We should live, act, and say nothing to the injury of anyone. It is not only best as a matter of principle, but it is the path to peace and honor.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I tremble for my country when I hear of confidence expressed in me. I know too well my weakness, that our only hope is in God.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: While we see the course of the final abolition of human slavery is onward, & we give it the aid of our prayers & all justifiable means in our power, we must leave the progress as well as the result in his hands who sees the end; who chooses to work by slow influences; & with whom two thousand years are but as a single day.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: We must expect reverses, even defeats. They are sent to teach us wisdom and prudence, to call forth greater energies, and to prevent our falling into greater disasters.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: In all my perplexities and distresses, the Bible has never failed to give me light and strength.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: We have fought this fight as long, and as well as we know how. We have been defeated. For us as a Christian people, there is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I have been up to see the Congress and they do not seem to be able to do anything except to eat peanuts and chew tobacco, while my army is starving.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I think it better to do right, even if we suffer in so doing, than to incur the reproach of our consciences and posterity.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: Do your duty in all things, like the old Puritan. You cannot do more; you should never wish to do less.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: A true man of honor feels humbled himself when he cannot help humbling others.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or keep one; the man who requires you to do so is dearly purchased at a sacrifice.
values.author: Robert E. Lee
values.authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army

values.authorQuote: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Forgive me my nonsense, as I also forgive the nonsense of those that think they talk sense.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: The best way out is always through.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Nothing can make injustice just but mercy.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: I hold it to be the inalienable right of anybody to go to hell in his own way.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: It's a funny thing that when a man hasn't anything on earth to worry about, he goes off and gets married.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Always fall in with what you're asked to accept. Take what is given, and make it over your way. My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever's going. Not against: with.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: If society fits you comfortably enough, you call it freedom.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: And were an epitaph to be my story I'd have a short one ready for my own. I would have written of me on my stone: I had a lover's quarrel with the world.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
values.author: Robert Frost

values.authorQuote: My only concern was to get home after a hard day's work.
