values.authorQuote: I have been refused entrance on the buses because I would not pay my fare at the front and go around to the rear door to enter. That was the custom if the bus was crowded up to the point where the white passengers would start occupying.
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: I don't think well of people who are prejudiced against people because of race. The only way for prejudiced people to change is for them to decide for themselves that all human beings should be treated fairly. We can't force them to think that way.
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: All I was doing was trying to get home from work.
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: Whatever my individual desires were to be free, I was not alone. There were many others who felt the same way.
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: Why do you all push us around?
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: It was not pre-arranged. It just happened that the driver made a demand and I just didn't feel like obeying his demand. I was quite tired after spending a full day working.
values.author: Rosa Parks

values.authorQuote: God could not be everywhere, and therefore he made mothers.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Never look backwards or you'll fall down the stairs.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: If you can keep your wits about you while all others are losing theirs, and blaming you. The world will be yours and everything in it, what's more, you'll be a man, my son.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: A woman is only a woman, but a good cigar is a smoke.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: A woman's guess is much more accurate than a man's certainty.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: We have forty million reasons for failure, but not a single excuse.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Small miseries, like small debts, hit us in so many places, and meet us at so many turns and corners, that what they want in weight, they make up in number, and render it less hazardous to stand the fire of one cannon ball, than a volley composed of such a shower of bullets.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: A man's mind is wont to tell him more than seven watchmen sitting in a tower.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew to serve your turn long after they are gone, and so hold on when there is nothing in you except the will which says to them: 'Hold on!'
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Heaven grant us patience with a man in love.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody, it saves so much trouble.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: The first condition of understanding a foreign country is to smell it.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: He travels the fastest who travels alone.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Borrow trouble for yourself, if that's your nature, but don't lend it to your neighbours.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: All the people like us are we, and everyone else is They.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: If I were dammed of body and soul, I know whose prayers would make me whole, mother o' mine o mother o' mine.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: For the female of the species is more deadly than the male.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Everyone is more or less mad on one point.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: If history were taught in the form of stories, it would never be forgotten.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Fill the unforgiving minute with sixty seconds worth of distance run.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: If I were hanged on the highest hill, Mother o' mine, O mother o' mine! I know whose love would follow me still Mother o' mine, O mother o' mine!
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: The silliest woman can manage a clever man; but it needs a very clever woman to manage a fool.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: I have struck a city - a real city - and they call it Chicago... I urgently desire never to see it again. It is inhabited by savages.
values.author: Rudyard Kipling

values.authorQuote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Beauty surrounds us, but usually we need to be walking in a garden to know it.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: We are born of love; Love is our mother.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: May this marriage be full of laughter, our every day in paradise.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Woman is a ray of God. She is not that earthly beloved: she is creative, not created.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Everyone has been made for some particular work, and the desire for that work has been put in every heart.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Listen! Clam up your mouth and be silent like an oyster shell, for that tongue of yours is the enemy of the soul, my friend. When the lips are silent, the heart has a hundred tongues.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Your depression is connected to your insolence and refusal to praise.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: You left and I cried tears of blood. My sorrow grows. Its not just that You left. But when You left my eyes went with You. Now, how will I cry?
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: The garden of love is green without limit and yields many fruits other than sorrow or joy. Love is beyond either condition: without spring, without autumn, it is always fresh.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: May these vows and this marriage be blessed.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Why should I be unhappy? Every parcel of my being is in full bloom.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Through Love all that is bitter will be sweet, Through Love all that is copper will be gold, Through Love all dregs will become wine, through Love all pain will turn to medicine.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: There are a thousand ways to kneel and kiss the ground; there are a thousand ways to go home again.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: That which is false troubles the heart, but truth brings joyous tranquillity.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: I am neither of the East nor of the West, no boundaries exist within my breast.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Love will find its way through all languages on its own.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: I have seen the king with a face of Glory, He who is the eye and the sun of heaven, He who is the companion and healer of all beings, He who is the soul and the universe that births souls.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: That which God said to the rose, and caused it to laugh in full-blown beauty, He said to my heart, and made it a hundred times more beautiful.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: Beg of God the removal of envy, that God may deliver you from externals, and bestow upon you an inward occupation, which will absorb you so that your attention is not drawn away.
values.author: Rumi
values.authorOccupation: Poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, Sufi mystic

values.authorQuote: My mother told me to be a lady. And for her, that meant be your own person, be independent.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: My mother told me two things constantly. One was to be a lady and the other was to be independent, and the law was something most unusual for those times because for most girls growing up in the '40s, the most important degree was not your B.A. but your M.R.S.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Arizona presents no specific reason for excepting capital defendants from the constitutional protections extended to defendants generally, and none is readily apparent.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: So that's the dissenter's hope: that they are writing not for today but for tomorrow.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The state controlling a woman would mean denying her full autonomy and full equality.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: All respect for the office of the presidency aside, I assumed that the obvious and unadulterated decline of freedom and constitutional sovereignty, not to mention the efforts to curb the power of judicial review, spoke for itself.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Reproductive choice has to be straightened out. There will never be a woman of means without choice anymore. That just seems to me so obvious. The states that changed their abortion laws before Roe are not going to change back. So we have a policy that only affects poor women, and it can never be otherwise.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Fight for the things that you care about, but do it in a way that will lead others to join you.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: You would have a huge statelessness problem if you don't consider a child born abroad a U.S. citizen.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I do a variety of weight-lifting, elliptical glider, stretching exercises, push-ups. And I do the Canadian Air Force exercises almost every day.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I said on the equality side of it, that it is essential to a woman's equality with man that she be the decision-maker, that her choice be controlling.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Frankly, I had thought that at the time Roe was decided, there was concern about population growth and particularly growth in populations that we don't want to have too many of.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The emphasis must be not on the right to abortion but on the right to privacy and reproductive control.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Reacting in anger or annoyance will not advance one's ability to persuade.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It is not women's liberation, it is women's and men's liberation.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: In the '50s, too many women, even though they were very smart, they tried to make the man feel that he was brainier. It was a sad thing.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: We have the oldest written constitution still in force in the world, and it starts out with three words, 'We, the people.'
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: America is known as a country that welcomes people to its shores. All kinds of people. The image of the Statue of Liberty with Emma Lazarus' famous poem. She lifts her lamp and welcomes people to the golden shore, where they will not experience prejudice because of the color of their skin, the religious faith that they follow.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It is not like I have gone crazy, I just don't want to take any chances. You never know what could happen.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: We had to go on and do the work of the court and we did.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: She never envisioned a legal career for me, but she did think it was very important that I be able to support myself, and I think she would be pleased to see what has become of me.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Women will only have true equality when men share with them the responsibility of bringing up the next generation.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: When police or prosecutors conceal significant exculpatory or impeaching material, we hold, it is ordinarily incumbent on the state to set the record straight.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I would not look to the U.S. Constitution if I were drafting a constitution in 2012.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: When a thoughtless or unkind word is spoken, best tune out.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: A gender line... helps to keep women not on a pedestal, but in a cage.
values.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
values.authorOccupation: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: Whatever makes an impression on the heart seems lovely in the eye.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: I fear God and next to God I mostly fear them that fear him not.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: A little and a little, collected together, becomes a great deal; the heap in the barn consists of single grains, and drop and drop make the inundation.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: Oman overall has great animal and plant biodiversity because it has mountains, desert, coastal areas and rich coral reefs.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: He who is a slave to his stomach seldom worships God.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: People are crying up the rich and variegated plumage of the peacock, and he is himself blushing at the sight of his ugly feet.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: Most of the birds of the Old World can be found here, as Oman is on a strategic route for migrating birds.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: An enemy to whom you show kindness becomes your friend, excepting lust, the indulgence of which increases its enmity.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity 'til he has tasted adversity.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: When Karim and his group heard about Saddam coming, they wanted to kill him, but fate had other ideas.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: The best loved by God are those that are rich, yet have the humility of the poor, and those that are poor and have the magnanimity of the rich.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: The beloved of the Almighty are: the rich who have the humility of the poor, and the poor who have the magnanimity of the rich.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: When the belly is empty, the body becomes spirit; and when it is full, the spirit becomes body.
values.author: Saadi
values.authorOccupation: Persian poet, literary of the medieval period

values.authorQuote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: It was pride that changed angels into devils; it is humility that makes men as angels.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: He that is jealous is not in love.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: The greatest evil is physical pain.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Thou hast created us for Thyself, and our heart is not quiet until it rests in Thee.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: O Holy Spirit, descend plentifully into my heart. Enlighten the dark corners of this neglected dwelling and scatter there Thy cheerful beams.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: In the absence of justice, what is sovereignty but organized robbery?
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: He who created us without our help will not save us without our consent.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: God judged it better to bring good out of evil than to suffer no evil to exist.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: If you believe what you like in the gospels, and reject what you don't like, it is not the gospel you believe, but yourself.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: It seems to me that an unjust law is no law at all.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Since you cannot do good to all, you are to pay special attention to those who, by the accidents of time, or place, or circumstances, are brought into closer connection with you.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Our bodies are shaped to bear children, and our lives are a working out of the processes of creation. All our ambitions and intelligence are beside that great elemental point.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Find out how much God has given you and from it take what you need; the remainder is needed by others.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Passion is the evil in adultery. If a man has no opportunity of living with another man's wife, but if it is obvious for some reason that he would like to do so, and would do so if he could, he is no less guilty than if he was caught in the act.
values.author: Saint Augustine

values.authorQuote: Prayer is an act of love; words are not needed. Even if sickness distracts from thoughts, all that is needed is the will to love.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: The tree that is beside the running water is fresher and gives more fruit.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: I do not fear Satan half so much as I fear those who fear him.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: When I took the habit, the Lord immediately showed me how He favours those who do violence to themselves in order to serve Him. No one saw what I endured... At the moment of my entrance into this new state I felt a joy so great that it has never failed me even to this day; and God converted the dryness of my soul into a very great tenderness.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: If Christ Jesus dwells in a man as his friend and noble leader, that man can endure all things, for Christ helps and strengthens us and never abandons us. He is a true friend.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: A beginner must look on himself as one setting out to make a garden for his Lord's pleasure, on most unfruitful soil which abounds in weeds. His Majesty roots up the weeds and will put in good plants instead. Let us reckon that this is already done when the soul decides to practice prayer and has begun to do so.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: The devil put before me that I could not endure the trials of the religious life, because of my delicate nurture. I defended myself against him by alleging the trials which Christ endured, and that it was not much for me to suffer something for His sake; besides, He would help me to bear it.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: God has been very good to me, for I never dwell upon anything wrong which a person has done, so as to remember it afterwards. If I do remember it, I always see some other virtue in that person.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: If I were to give advice, I would say to parents that they ought to be very careful whom they allow to mix with their children when young; for much mischief thence ensues, and our natural inclinations are unto evil rather than unto good.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Pain is never permanent.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Anyone who truly loves God travels securely.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: What value is there in faith without works? And what are they worth if they are not united to the merits of Jesus Christ, our only good?
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Mental prayer in my opinion is nothing else than an intimate sharing between friends; it means taking time frequently to be alone with Him who we know loves us. The important thing is not to think much but to love much and so do that which best stirs you to love. Love is not great delight but desire to please God in everything.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: The feeling remains that God is on the journey, too.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Our souls may lose their peace and even disturb other people's, if we are always criticizing trivial actions - which often are not real defects at all, but we construe them wrongly through our ignorance of their motives.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: May God protect me from gloomy saints.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: I thought of the soul as resembling a castle, formed of a single diamond or a very transparent crystal, and containing many rooms, just as in Heaven there are many mansions.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: I had many friends to help me to fall; but as to rising again, I was so much left to myself, that I wonder now I was not always on the ground. I praise God for His mercy; for it was He only Who stretched out His hand to me. May He be blessed for ever! Amen.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: My father was a man of great charity towards the poor, and compassion for the sick, and also for servants; so much so, that he never could be persuaded to keep slaves, for he pitied them so much: and a slave belonging to one of his brothers being once in his house, was treated by him with as much tenderness as his own children.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Those who give themselves to prayer should in a special manner have always a devotion to St. Joseph; for I know not how any man can think of the Queen of the angels, during the time that she suffered so much with the Infant Jesus, without giving thanks to St. Joseph for the services he rendered them then.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: Do you think it is only a little thing to possess a house from which lovely things can be seen?
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
values.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
values.authorOccupation: Spanist mystic, Roman Catholic saint, Carmelite nun, author

values.authorQuote: All adventures, especially into new territory, are scary.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: The stars don't look bigger, but they do look brighter.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: For whatever reason, I didn't succumb to the stereotype that science wasn't for girls. I got encouragement from my parents. I never ran into a teacher or a counselor who told me that science was for boys. A lot of my friends did.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Studying whether there's life on Mars or studying how the universe began, there's something magical about pushing back the frontiers of knowledge. That's something that is almost part of being human, and I'm certain that will continue.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: I've spent my whole life not talking to people, and I don't see why I should start now.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: After the Challenger accident, NASA put in a lot of time to improve the safety of the space shuttle to fix the things that had gone wrong.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Rocket science is tough, and rockets have a way of failing.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: My parents must have done a great job. Anytime I wanted to pursue something that they weren't familiar with, that was not part of their lifestyle, they let me go ahead and do it.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: But even in elementary school and junior high, I was very interested in space and in the space program.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: But when I wasn't working, I was usually at a window looking down at Earth.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: We can see cities during the day and at night, and we can watch rivers dump sediment into the ocean, and see hurricanes form.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Then during the mission itself, I used the space shuttle's robot arm to release a satellite into orbit.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: When you're getting ready to launch into space, you're sitting on a big explosion waiting to happen.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Science is fun. Science is curiosity. We all have natural curiosity. Science is a process of investigating. It's posing questions and coming up with a method. It's delving in.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: I think it's important for little girls growing up, and young women, to have one in every walk of life. So from that point of view, I'm proud to be a role model!
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: So most astronauts getting ready to lift off are excited and very anxious and worried about that explosion - because if something goes wrong in the first seconds of launch, there's not very much you can do.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: The view of Earth is spectacular.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: When the space shuttle's engines cut off, and you're finally in space, in orbit, weightless... I remember unstrapping from my seat, floating over to the window, and that's when I got my first view of Earth. Just a spectacular view, and a chance to see our planet as a planet.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: On a standard space shuttle crew, two of the astronauts have a test pilot background - the commander and the pilot.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: The fact that I was going to be the first American woman to go into space carried huge expectations along with it.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: No, I think most astronauts recognize that the space shuttle program is very high-risk, and are prepared for accidents.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Because I was a tennis player, Billie Jean King was a hero of mine.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: I liked math - that was my favorite subject - and I was very interested in astronomy and in physical science.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Yes, I did feel a special responsibility to be the first American woman in space.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: So most astronauts are astronauts for a couple of years before they are assigned to a flight.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: The pressure suit helps if something goes wrong during launch or re-entry - astronauts have a way to parachute off the shuttle. The suits protect you from loss of pressure in case of emergency.
values.author: Sally Ride

values.authorQuote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: The only difference between me and a madman is that I'm not mad.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: The difference between false memories and true ones is the same as for jewels: it is always the false ones that look the most real, the most brilliant.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: There are some days when I think I'm going to die from an overdose of satisfaction.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Let my enemies devour each other.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Instead of stubbornly attempting to use surrealism for purposes of subversion, it is necessary to try to make of surrealism something as solid, complete and classic as the works of museums.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: I seated ugliness on my knee, and almost immediately grew tired of it.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: There is only one difference between a madman and me. The madman thinks he is sane. I know I am mad.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Those who do not want to imitate anything, produce nothing.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: It is good taste, and good taste alone, that possesses the power to sterilize and is always the first handicap to any creative functioning.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: I do not paint a portrait to look like the subject, rather does the person grow to look like his portrait.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Liking money like I like it, is nothing less than mysticism. Money is a glory.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Don't bother about being modern. Unfortunately it is the one thing that, whatever you do, you cannot avoid.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: Take me, I am the drug; take me, I am hallucinogenic.
values.author: Salvador Dali
values.authorBirthname: Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech

values.authorQuote: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: We're all working together; that's the secret.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: High expectations are the key to everything.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Celebrate your successes. Find some humor in your failures.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: The way management treats associates is exactly how the associates will treat the customers.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: The key to success is to get out into the store and listen to what the associates have to say.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Control your expenses better than your competition. This is where you can always find the competitive advantage.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: I probably have traveled and walked into more variety stores than anybody in America.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Each Wal-Mart store should reflect the values of its customers and support the vision they hold for their community.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: If everybody is doing it one way, there's a good chance you can find your niche by going exactly in the opposite direction.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: We let folks know we're interested in them and that they're vital to us. cause they are.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: All of us profit from being corrected - if we're corrected in a positive way.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Capital isn't scarce; vision is.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: All that hullabaloo about somebody's net worth is just stupid, and it's made my life a lot more complex and difficult.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: What am I supposed to haul my dogs around in, a Rolls-Royce?
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: I don't know what would have happened to Wal-Mart if we had laid low and never stirred up the competition. My guess is that we would have remained a strictly regional operator.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: I learned this early on in the variety business: You've got to give folks responsibility, you've got to trust them, and then you've got to check on them.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: You can make a lot of mistakes and still recover if you run an efficient operation. Or you can be brilliant and still go out of business if you're too inefficient.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: I've never been one to dwell on reverses.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Maybe I was born to be a merchant, maybe it was fate. I don't know about that. But I know this for sure: I loved retail from the very beginning.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: I learned early on that one of the secrets of campus leadership was the simplest thing of all: speak to people coming down the sidewalk before they speak to you. I would always look ahead and speak to the person coming toward me. If I knew them I would call them by name, but even if I didn't I would still speak to them.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: If you love your work, you'll be out there every day trying to do it the best you possibly can, and pretty soon everybody around will catch the passion from you - like a fever.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Share your profits with all your associates, and treat them as partners. In turn, they will treat you as a partner, and together you will all perform beyond your wildest expectations.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Exceed your customer's expectations. If you do, they'll come back over and over. Give them what they want - and a little more.
values.author: Sam Walton
values.authorOccupation: Founder of Walmart and Sam's Club

values.authorQuote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: I can't go on. I'll go on.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Every word is like an unnecessary stain on silence and nothingness.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: It is right that he too should have his little chronicle, his memories, his reason, and be able to recognize the good in the bad, the bad in the worst, and so grow gently old down all the unchanging days, and die one day like any other day, only shorter.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: There's man all over for you, blaming on his boots the fault of his feet.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Habit is a great deadener.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: You're on earth. There's no cure for that.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: To find a form that accommodates the mess, that is the task of the artist now.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: The tears of the world are a constant quality. For each one who begins to weep, somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Words are all we have.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: James Joyce was a synthesizer, trying to bring in as much as he could. I am an analyzer, trying to leave out as much as I can.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: If you do not love me I shall not be loved If I do not love you I shall not love.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: I write about myself with the same pencil and in the same exercise book as about him. It is no longer I, but another whose life is just beginning.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Birth was the death of him.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Nothing is funnier than unhappiness, I grant you that. Yes, yes, it's the most comical thing in the world.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Do we mean love, when we say love?
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Nothing matters but the writing. There has been nothing else worthwhile... a stain upon the silence.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: In the landscape of extinction, precision is next to godliness.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Poets are the sense, philosophers the intelligence of humanity.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: All I know is what the words know, and dead things, and that makes a handsome little sum, with a beginning and a middle and an end, as in the well-built phrase and the long sonata of the dead.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: I have my faults, but changing my tune is not one of them.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Dublin university contains the cream of Ireland: Rich and thick.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Just under the surface I shall be, all together at first, then separate and drift, through all the earth and perhaps in the end through a cliff into the sea, something of me. A ton of worms in an acre, that is a wonderful thought, a ton of worms, I believe it.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Let me go to hell, that's all I ask, and go on cursing them there, and them look down and hear me, that might take some of the shine off their bliss.
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: We are not saints, but we have kept our appointment. How many people can boast as much?
values.author: Samuel Beckett
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, playwright, poet, theatre director, essayist, literary translator

values.authorQuote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Revenge is an act of passion; vengeance of justice. Injuries are revenged; crimes are avenged.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value only to its scarcity.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Kindness is in our power, even when fondness is not.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Agriculture not only gives riches to a nation, but the only riches she can call her own.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: The world is like a grand staircase, some are going up and some are going down.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: All theory is against freedom of the will; all experience for it.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: No man can taste the fruits of autumn while he is delighting his scent with the flowers of spring.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: No man will be a sailor who has contrivance enough to get himself into a jail; for being in a ship is being in a jail, with the chance of being drowned... a man in a jail has more room, better food, and commonly better company.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: I look upon every day to be lost, in which I do not make a new acquaintance.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: If your determination is fixed, I do not counsel you to despair. Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: The mind is never satisfied with the objects immediately before it, but is always breaking away from the present moment, and losing itself in schemes of future felicity... The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Few enterprises of great labor or hazard would be undertaken if we had not the power of magnifying the advantages we expect from them.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: To be happy at home is the ultimate result of all ambition, the end to which every enterprise and labor tends, and of which every desire prompts the prosecution.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: When making your choice in life, do not neglect to live.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: There are goods so opposed that we cannot seize both, but, by too much prudence, may pass between them at too great a distance to reach either.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Almost every man wastes part of his life attempting to display qualities which he does not possess.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: He that will enjoy the brightness of sunshine, must quit the coolness of the shade.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: I never desire to converse with a man who has written more than he has read.
values.author: Samuel Johnson

values.authorQuote: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father's protection.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: Flowers are restful to look at. They have neither emotions nor conflicts.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: Dreams are often most profound when they seem the most crazy.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: The mind is like an iceberg, it floats with one-seventh of its bulk above water.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
values.author: Sigmund Freud
values.authorBirthplace: Freiberg in Mähren, Moravia, Austrian Empire

values.authorQuote: We are never so defensless against suffering as when we love.

values.authorQuote: Champions are not the ones who always win races - champions are the ones who get out there and try. And try harder the next time. And even harder the next time. values.authorQuote: A five minute call replaces the time it takes to read and reply to the original email and read and reply to their reply... or replies. And I no longer spend 20+ minutes crafting the perfect email - no need to.

values.authorQuote: Leadership is absolutely about inspiring action, but it is also about guarding against mis-action.

values.authorQuote: Starbucks was founded around the experience and the environment of their stores. The coffee was incidental.
